channel.title: GANs on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in GANs on Memo Tut

item.title: I tried moving food with SinGAN
item.description: #Introduction I have disturbed the empty frame of Production/Counting Advent Calendar 2019. I’ve been playing around with SinGAN a lot lately, so I’ll try to summarize the results. SinGAN is a paper that became a hot topic because it was selected as the best paper at ICCV 2019. It’s great for learning with just one image and generating images of any size with the same features. ![Screenshot from 2019-12-24 18-23-29.

item.title: I wanted to convert a portrait to a Yuyu style.
item.description: # 1.First of all This article is the 24th day article of Yuyuki AdventCalender 2019. 2. What you want to do I want to go to the world of Yuyu â†’ I want to convert a facial photograph into a Yuyu style Last year at Advent Calender, I tried automatic coloring of black and white cartoons with CycleGAN. (Trying to colorize manga in CycleGAN ~Yuyu ceremony~)) CycleGAN is good at style conversion such as changing colors and textures, but it is not good at shape conversion.

item.title: Generate Pokemon with Deep Learning
item.description: #Introduction This article is the 16th day article of Kinki University Advent Calendar 2019. I don’t know what the decoction is, but I will generate a Pokemon image with Gan. In the future, I would like to add a description of Pokemon picture book to the generated image. The source code is here DCGAN DCGAN was used for image generation. For details, see Papers. The implementation used DCGAN-tensorflow,butforsomereasontherewasabugintheofficialsourcecode,sofixed is used.

item.title: History of major GAN studies (as of November 2019)
item.description: ### For people like this: point_up_tone1: GAN (Generative Adversarial Network) was announced in 2014, but due to epoch-making research, there are many derivative researches recently, and what is it? .. I myself made full use of Google professor to do various research, but I couldn’t find any Japanese literature that summarizes major related research in an easy-to-understand way, sorry! So, this article is for those who want to get an outline of the flow of GAN-related research, or for those who want to jump over each research ~~ one by one with quick and one-click jumping to the paper and code.
